body_html:
Hi,
I've got the same problem recently. Some time ago I installed CUDA Toolkit 9.0 with torch and its cuda90 already installed (still don't know is it okay or not, I didn't find anything about it).
Ankit's GDB backtrace output is almost the same with mine:

(gdb) r -c "import torch"
Starting program: /home/fetisov/anaconda2/envs/imp/bin/python -c "import torch"
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000002260 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0 0x0000000000002260 in ?? ()
#1 0x00007ffff7de76ba in call_init (l=, argc=argc@entry=3,
argv=argv@entry=0x7fffffffdbf8, env=env@entry=0x555555888590)
at dl-init.c:72
#2 0x00007ffff7de77cb in call_init (env=0x555555888590, argv=0x7fffffffdbf8,
argc=3, l=) at dl-init.c:30
#3 _dl_init (main_map=main_map@entry=0x555555c17f70, argc=3,
argv=0x7fffffffdbf8, env=0x555555888590) at dl-init.c:120
#4 0x00007ffff7dec8e2 in dl_open_worker (a=a@entry=0x7fffffffcae0)
at dl-open.c:575
#5 0x00007ffff7de7564 in _dl_catch_error (
objname=objname@entry=0x7fffffffcad0,
errstring=errstring@entry=0x7fffffffcad8,
mallocedp=mallocedp@entry=0x7fffffffcacf,
operate=operate@entry=0x7ffff7dec4d0 <dl_open_worker>,
args=args@entry=0x7fffffffcae0) at dl-error.c:187
#6 0x00007ffff7debda9 in _dl_open (
file=0x555555823c30 "/home/fetisov/anaconda2/envs/imp/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/_C.so", mode=-2147483391,
caller_dlopen=0x7ffff7b08791 <_PyImport_GetDynLoadFunc+289>, nsid=-2,
argc=, argv=, env=0x555555888590)
at dl-open.c:660
#7 0x00007ffff75d8f09 in dlopen_doit (a=a@entry=0x7fffffffcd10) at dlopen.c:66
---Type to continue, or q to quit---

I use an anaconda environment and python 2.7.

ldd output is following:
ldd /home/fetisov/anaconda2/envs/imp/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/_C.so

libmkl_gnu_thread.so => /home/fetisov/anaconda2/envs/imp/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libmkl_gnu_thread.so (0x00007fdd32a37000)

Has anyone found smth on how to fix it?

UPD: another user of my machine who has python 3.6 in his environment with pytorch is able to import torch, but cuda is still unavailable...

Hi,
I've got the same problem recently. Some time ago I installed CUDA Toolkit 9.0 with torch and its cuda90 already installed (still don't know is it okay or not, I didn't find anything about it).
Ankit's GDB backtrace output is almost the same with mine:
(gdb) r -c "import torch"
Starting program: /home/fetisov/anaconda2/envs/imp/bin/python -c "import torch"

body:
Hi,
I've got the same problem recently. Some time ago I installed CUDA Toolkit 9.0 with torch and its cuda90 already installed (still don't know is it okay or not, I didn't find anything about it).
Ankit's GDB backtrace output is almost the same with mine: 

(gdb) r -c "import torch"
Starting program: /home/fetisov/anaconda2/envs/imp/bin/python -c "import torch"
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000002260 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x0000000000002260 in ?? ()
#1  0x00007ffff7de76ba in call_init (l=<optimized out>, argc=argc@entry=3, 
    argv=argv@entry=0x7fffffffdbf8, env=env@entry=0x555555888590)
    at dl-init.c:72
#2  0x00007ffff7de77cb in call_init (env=0x555555888590, argv=0x7fffffffdbf8, 
    argc=3, l=<optimized out>) at dl-init.c:30
#3  _dl_init (main_map=main_map@entry=0x555555c17f70, argc=3, 
    argv=0x7fffffffdbf8, env=0x555555888590) at dl-init.c:120
#4  0x00007ffff7dec8e2 in dl_open_worker (a=a@entry=0x7fffffffcae0)
    at dl-open.c:575
#5  0x00007ffff7de7564 in _dl_catch_error (
    objname=objname@entry=0x7fffffffcad0, 
    errstring=errstring@entry=0x7fffffffcad8, 
    mallocedp=mallocedp@entry=0x7fffffffcacf, 
    operate=operate@entry=0x7ffff7dec4d0 <dl_open_worker>, 
    args=args@entry=0x7fffffffcae0) at dl-error.c:187
#6  0x00007ffff7debda9 in _dl_open (
